GamePlay
Class GamePlayManager

java.lang.Object
  SystemController.GameState
      GamePlay.GamePlayManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class GamePlayManager
extends GameState
implements java.io.Serializable

Control structure in charge of updating the object models present during gameplay and also rendering them on the screen.

See Also:
Serialized Form

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

GamePlayManager

public GamePlayManager(GameStateManager gsm,
                       int selectedStage)
Initialize an instance of GamePlayManager, which will control and execute all the logic needed for the gamePlay state of the game.

Parameters:
gsm - An instance of the highest controller of the application, which allows the GamePlayManager to pass control to the MenuManager.
selectedStage - An integer specifying the stage selected by the user to load the stage data..
Method Detail

draw

public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
Draws the specific GamePlayState that the user is currently found in. The user can be in one of the following options during gamePlay: GAMEOVER, PAUSE, INGAME, FINISHEDGAME.

Specified by:
draw in class GameState
Parameters:
g - The Graphics2D object where all the objects are drawn.

executeInGameLogic

public void executeInGameLogic(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
Executes the logic tied to the current GamePlayState. It triggers stage transitions, and notifications. And it also calls the methods necessary to draw all the objects present during GamePlay.

Parameters:
g -

inStageTransition

public void inStageTransition(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
This method gets called once the player has completed a stage. It draws a transition screen notifying the player that they are advancing to the next stage.

Parameters:
g - The Graphics2D object where all the StageTransition notification is drawn.

drawHUD

public void drawHUD(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                    boolean bonusStage,
                    int timeToHarderSetSpawn)
Draws the heads-up display notifying the user of the time remaining in the stage, the number of lives they have remaining, and their score so far in the current game session.

Parameters:
g - The Graphics2D object where GamePlay is drawn.
bonusStage - A boolean specifying whether the current stage is a bonus stage. If this is the case, the timer drawn starts at 30 seconds and not 200.
timeToHarderSetSpawn - The time remaining before a harder set of enemy is spawned. This is the default timer used in regular stages.

notificationDurationCountDown

public boolean notificationDurationCountDown()
General timer used to control the duration of the following notifications present during GamePlay: game completed, game over, and stage transition. These notifications all last 1.66 seconds.

Returns:

initiateTimerToNextStageFromBonusStage

public void initiateTimerToNextStageFromBonusStage()
Timer used to control the duration of a bonus stage, which does not end with the player going through a door, but instead has a limited duration of 30 seconds.

initiateTimeToSpawnEnemy

public void initiateTimeToSpawnEnemy()
Timer used to control the spawn rate of new enemies during a bonus stage. During a bonus stage, a single type of enemy spawns an every second for 30 seconds.

updateCamera

public void updateCamera()
Updates the position of the camera so that it follows the player once it has crossed the 15 tile threshold.

checkCollisions

public void checkCollisions()
Passes all the data used for collision detection to the collision manager. We check for collisions every time a new frame is drawn.

keyPressed

public void keyPressed(int k)
Pass user input to the Player object contained in this instance of GamePlayManager. The Player object is the terminal receiver of the input signals from the user. time

Specified by:
keyPressed in class GameState
Parameters:
k - Integer specifying the code of the key pressed by the user.

keyReleased

public void keyReleased(int k)
Pass user input to the Player object contained in this instance of GamePlayManager. The Player object is the terminal receiver of the input signals from the user. time

Specified by:
keyReleased in class GameState
Parameters:
k - Integer specifying the code of the key released by the user.

setGamePlayStateToInGame

public void setGamePlayStateToInGame()
Sets the current GamePlayState of the player object contained in this instance of GamePlayManager to INGAME.

getSaveFileName

public java.lang.String getSaveFileName()
Retrieves the String associated with this instance of GamePlayManager that is assigned right before serialization.

Returns:
A String specifying the save file name associated with this instance of GamePlayManager.

setSaveFileName

public void setSaveFileName(java.lang.String saveFileName)
Set the saveFileName associated with this instance of GamePlayManager

Parameters:
saveFileName - A String specifying the name of the file in which this instance of GamePlayManager is being serialized.
